data.title: ok-but overpriced and some disappointments
data.text: Was hoping for the jazz brunch for a belated fathers day. as it turns out- jazz is only the first sunday of the month- but couldn't tell that from the website. Prime rib station, omlettes to order, hot plates including salmon and chicken, a nice cold cheese and shrimp station, and reasonable desert table. But for the $30 per person, I was disappointed in the overall selection, and the waffle station was actually a machine you pour batter into- like at the hotels with an included breakfast in the lobby....well below par for this hotel and the price tag, despite the unlimited champagne. I thought the overall experience was more expensive and less enjoyable that 2 year ago when we went.

data.title: Summer Doldrums
data.text: Cafe is only open Friday and Saturday evenings during the summer with a limited menu. The website doesn't reflect these shortened hours, The menu that is on the website is a very old menu and they say they can't remove it because they don't own the website. Very strange and not helpful. Their hamburger was 8 ounces and very good.The salmon dinner was good. Friday night special was Prime Rib at $19.95 which is a little pricey for a cafe special. If you are in the vicinity and want a light meal, it is OK.

data.title: Great Breakfast Buffet
data.text: There is a fantastic breakfast buffet with a wide variety of items including made to order omelets.  Great fruit options and even French toast with strawberries and cream.

data.title: Very disappointing Mother's Day Brunch
data.text: Over priced and under whelming.  For the price ($45 plus $13 for taxes and gratuity) I expected a great meal and a special experience for my family - mother-in-law, wife, two sons, their wives and 5 grandchildren.  We all felt the price was comparable to some other great brunches we had enjoyed, but the food quality and variety were sorely lacking.  We will never make this mistake again.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text:
We stayed at the San Marcos hotel & breakfast was included. It was described as a continental but i would disagree! It was a full meal! You could get a made to order omelette, and/or choose from the buffet style spread. 

There were scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, pancakes, waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc. plus coffee, juice, water & soda.

I was more than full when I left!

data.title: overpriced breakfast buffet
data.text: Only choice for breakfast was buffet at $15.95/person.  Same as what you get for free at other hotels.

data.title: Good Breakfast Buffet
data.text: AJ's Café is in the Crowne Plaza San Marcos Hotel.  The café is clean and bright.  Tables are not crowded together. At the breakfast buffet there was an omelet station, as well as scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, French toast, pancakes and waffles, breads, pastries and fruits. Typical breakfast juices and coffee.  The food was plentiful and hot.  Service was fair as the wait staff did not offer refills for coffee, etc. Had a nice time with friends.  Would go back.

data.title: Very nice place
data.text: Food and service have been excellent.  Nice and quiet.  It is in an historic resort hotel from Chandler's early days.

data.title: Pricey, but enjoyed Sunday Brunch Buffet
data.text: It seems hard to find "Sunday Brunch" as a buffet anymore. Our last visit was about a year ago.  The price is higher now.  They have a buffet breakfast on Sunday, but the Sunday Brunch starts at 10 am.  We arrived before 10, were seated and served water, coffee (gotta' have that right away), and offered a Mimosa (he ordered) or Poinsettia (she ordered), both were good and were included in the $26.95 pp.  Our server brought a coffee pot to the table (always appreciated) to ward off that empty cup syndrome at breakfast.  Food included an omelet station, prime rib, sausage, bacon, cheeses, waffles, steamed veggies, shrimp ka-bob, beef/gravy, desserts of all kinds, chocolate dip, fresh fruit, whip cream, hot syrup, bagels, and more.  Everything was really, really, good.  No complaints on the food selection or preparation.  Brunch was busy with other diners, but not crowded or annoying which makes it nice because we like to take our time and enjoy these types of meals.  The staff never made us feel rushed, yet were always available when service was needed.  If you don't mind the cost for a special Sunday meal, we recommend this Sunday Brunch Buffet.    The four stars are because of the cost. We could easily forgo the Mimosa/Poinsettia if they would reduce the cost per person appropriately and we would go back more often.

data.title: Would probaly go again
data.text: My husband and I went last Sunday after church. I ordered from the menu and he ordered the buffet. We had received a restaurant.com $25 gift certificate and that made a little dent in the $75+ price. I overheard the server tell someone that the Mother's day brunch would be in the upper $40 per person range and I was shocked but then I realized that I did not know what items would be offered and perhaps they would be worth that amount. My husband who is a foodie said he was pleased and satisfied with the prime rib, mimosa (did not have much juice) and made to order omelet on the buffet. I felt my meal; a Reuben with well seasoned corned beef was affordably priced, plentiful and tasty, especially the Seasoned fries. I liked the atmosphere because you had the choice of indoors or on the lovely patio. Servers were not exceptional, just OK. We've lived in Chandler for over 20 years and it was nice to finally be able to see the inside of the historic hotel. Would probably go again but at least this time we would be prepared for the cost and not need a coupon.

data.title: Not Worth it
data.text: The seating was about the same as any restaurant. Our fault choosing a table not far enough from the door. Two flies bothered the hell out of us through the meal. The soup was luke warm. I probably could have sent it back, but didn't feel it would be worth it.I ordered a Reuben. It was served on a Hamburger bun? Funny, all my life they were served on toasted Rye.The corned beef was too fatty for my tastes. For the price, one would expect premium meat,nice and lean. Guess my expectations were too high. The Seasoned fries were very good. If I'm ever in the mood for seasoned fries, maybe I'll drop by, though my wife and I agree we won't be returning.

data.title: Improved Breakfast Buffet
data.text: I have been going to the San Marcos Resort, even before it was Crown Royal, for several years running. Prior to the renovation a couple of years back, the breakfast buffet was eh. This year they have added a custom order omelet station and a waffle maker, with the addition of meats and cheeses to the buffet. I was very pleased with this improvement. At $14.00, it is not pricey for a breakfast buffet, considering that I usually pay that for a breakfast at D___y's and receive much less food.

data.title: The only hope is the Crowne Plaza people will spend some money on upgrading AJs service and food.
data.text:
The San Marcos Resort has changed owners with much work recently completed on the rooms and golf course. The hotel lobby has always been well done and attractive with the bar and AJs Restaurant adjacent. Having dined in AJs several times over then past 12 months, my perspective hasn't changed. Perhaps it was due to the day being Sunday after Thanksgiving but the room has never had any energy with more workers than customers. 
As the guest of someone else I was reluctant diner. The only hope is the Crowne Plaza people will spend some money on upgrading AJs service and food. Waitstaff and food preparation can be trained and improved. As it is now, it's a case of where to start -  even the coffee was lukewarm. One sweet spot was the dessert table which was just fine.  Another reviewer mentioned there are other nearby restaurants which is true as a search of Tripadvisor will show.
AJs has a great facility with nice outside dining. It just needs attention.

data.title: OVERPRICED AND CHEESY
data.text: My wife, some friends and I went to AJ's Restaurant at the Crowne Plaza/San Marcos Golf Resort in Chandler, AZ for Thanksgiving dinner yesterday. We were charged $44.95 per dinner per person, with an automatic 20% gratuity added to the total bill. The portions were skimpy, the service was almost non-existent and the food was cold. I didn't complain about it, since the mood with our friends at the table was comfortable and relaxed and I didn't want to destroy the pleasant atmosphere among us, but I felt that we were blindsided by the poor service, cold food and ridiculously exorbitant price we were charged. I can no longer trust AJ's Restaurant and you best be believing that I will NEVER, EVER RETURN to that establishment for more abuse. There are much better alternatives for dinner during special occasions. I strongly recommend you AVOID AJ's Restaurant, unless you enjoy being abused.

data.title: You've got to be kidding me.
data.text: We had stayed at the hotel and after determining that our $200 a night room didn't include a breakfast we decided to go to the hotel's restaurant, AJs.  The prices were a bit high for breakfast, as one might expect from a restaurant located in a resort ($4 for a cup of coffee, $15 dollars a plate for most dishes).  I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my girlfriend ordered the  American Breakfast (bacon, eggs, toast, house potatoes).  Both of our meals were bland, my poached eggs were over done and so were her sunny sides.  The potatoes were overcooked, dried out, and lacking any seasoning.  I had requested Tabasco but didn't receive any and we didn't see our waiter again until after I had finished my meal.  On a happy note my girlfriend's toast was good.  Needless to say, this restaurant is one to miss, especially with all the great choices in the neighborhood.

data.title: Restaurant 11/09/13
data.text:
Last evening my husband and I had dinner at your restaurant with 4 other friends.  It was by far the worst service that any of us have ever experienced.  Our waiter, Travis, completely ignored us. He disappeared.  Our drinks were not filled nor were we offered the dessert that came with our meal.  Love your restaurant, however, Travis needs to be properly trained; he has no clue.  Our checks were all incorrect.  Ours was overcharged by $15.00 which we caught.  I have always gotten excellent service from your bus boy, Justin.  Perhaps you should train him for your wait staff.  We are all local; not traveling.
Sincerely,
Carolyn L.
